required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Assessment of Aspirin Plus Prednisone Treatment for Euthyroid Women With Thyroid Autoimmunity
clinical_study.official_title: An Assessment of Aspirin Plus Prednisone Treatment for Euthyroid Women With Thyroid Autoimmunity Undergoing In Vitro Fertilization

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: Thyroid autoimmunity(TAI) per se have adverse effect on pregnancy outcomesï¼Œand aspirin and prednisone were used frequently in antithyroid antibodies(ATA) positive infertile women in clinical practice, but the impact of these medicines is still controversial. Therefore, aim of the study was to investigate whether or not the treatment of prednisone in addition to aspirin was capable of improving reproductive outcomes in euthyroid infertile women.

detailed_description.textblock: A multicenter retrospective study performed during the period of 2017 to 2020 and euthyroid infertile women positive for anti-thyroperoxidase antibody (TPOAb) and/or thyroglobulin antibody (TgAb) alone with thyroid stimulating hormone 0.35-4.0mIU/L undergoing first in vitro fertilization and embryo transfer(IVF-ET) cycle were recruited in our study.Data analysis was performed using the Statistics Package for Social Sciences.In the end, the value of prednisone plus aspirin treatment was investigated to make a big contribution on clinical practice.

primary_outcome.description: Clinical pregnancy was defined as the existence of a viable embryo within an intrauterine gestational sac

arm_group.description: aspirin: tablet 100mg qd 2-5weeks prednisone: tablet 10mg qd 2-5weeks

intervention.description: Discontinue medication based on early pregnancy outcome

study_pop.textblock: Both TPOAb and TgAb in all the subjects were measured before ART procedure, and their thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) level ranged from 0.35-4.0mIU/L and also they all underwent first embryo transfer without previous IVF history.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Both TPOAb and TgAb in all the subjects were measured before ART procedure
2. Thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) level ranged from 0.35-4.0mIU/L
3. Women underwent first embryo transfer without previous IVF history.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Abnormal thyroid function test
2. Women with known autoimmune diseases or clinical presentations of autoimmune disorders
